heisig_chinese_memo: The courier will deliver no matter what kind of water he is splashing around in.
Ru_trainchinese: pō: (глаг/прил) выливать, выплескивать, разбрызгивать; грубый, сумасбродный; энергичный, решительный
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When the courier delivers something watery like a soup he makes sure not to splash it around too much.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water ", "to make " sound, the original meaning is to pour the liquid outward to spread it out. The Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie's "Qi Min Yao Shu ‧ Creation of Divine Koji and Wine": "Draw 20 dendrites of water, don't make people splash water."

" Pouring " can mean cooking or boiling. Tang Zhang Youxin "The Notes of Sencha Water": "Across the Tonglu River to Yanzise, the color of the stream is clear, and the water tastes very cold. The family members splashed it with old black and bad tea, and it was all aromatic."

" Splashing " also generally refers to things spilling out of an inclined or overturned container. "The Scholars" Chapter 10: "Chen Hefu was startled, and stood up in a panic. His sleeves turned the bowl of powder soup over and splashed the table."

" Po " is also used as an adjective to describe fierce and arrogant. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 44: "Sister Feng, seeing people coming, didn't splash like she did before. She smashed everyone down and ran to Jia's mother crying."

" Po " can also be described as extremely large and numerous. Yuan Zhang Guobin's "He Undershirt" 4% off: "If you talk about my ancestors, good furniture is like splashing the sky."

" Po " is also used as an adverb to express degree, which is equivalent to " very ". Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion-Surprise Dream": "Helplessly, waking up the screen window to sleep inconvenience. Pour fresh cold sweat and fry.
humanum_short_description_en: From " water ", "to make " sound, the original meaning is to pour the liquid outward to spread it out.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「發」聲，本義為將液體向外傾灑，使散開。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧造神麴並酒》：「汲水二十斛，勿令人潑水。」

　　「潑」可表示烹，煮。唐張又新〈煎茶水記〉：「過桐廬江至嚴子瀨，溪色至清，水味甚冷，家人輩用陳黑壞茶潑之，皆至芳香。」

　　「潑」還泛指東西從傾斜或翻倒的容器裡瀉出。《儒林外史》第10回：「陳和甫嚇了一驚，慌立起來，衣袖又把粉湯碗招翻，潑了一桌。」

　　「潑」也作形容詞，形容凶悍、蠻橫。《紅樓夢》第44回：「鳳姐兒見人來了，便不似先前那般潑了，撂下眾人，便哭着往賈母那邊跑。」

　　「潑」也形容極大、極多。元張國賓〈合汗衫〉第4摺：「若說着俺祖先，好家私似潑天。」

　　「潑」亦作副詞，表示程度，相當於「很」。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧驚夢》：「無奈高堂，喚醒紗窗睡不便。潑新鮮冷汗粘煎。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「發」聲，本義為將液體向外傾灑，使散開。

Chinese: The courier will deliver no matter what kind of water he is splashing around in.
Meaning: splash
Hanzi: 泼
Story: When the courier delivers something watery like a soup he makes sure not to splash it around too much.
Kind: traditional
從「 水 」，「 發 」聲，本義為將液體向外傾灑，使散開。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧造神麴並酒》：「汲水二十斛，勿令人潑水。」 「 潑 」可表示烹，煮。唐張又新〈煎茶水記〉：「過桐廬江至嚴子瀨，溪色至清，水味甚冷，家人輩用陳黑壞茶潑之，皆至芳香。」 「 潑 」還泛指東西從傾斜或翻倒的容器裡瀉出。《儒林外史》第10回：「陳和甫嚇了一驚，慌立起來，衣袖又把粉湯碗招翻，潑了一桌。」 「 潑 」也作形容詞，形容凶悍、蠻橫。《紅樓夢》第44回：「鳳姐兒見人來了，便不似先前那般潑了，撂下眾人，便哭着往賈母那邊跑。」 「 潑 」也形容極大、極多。元張國賓〈合汗衫〉第4摺：「若說着俺祖先，好家私似潑天。」 「 潑 」亦作副詞，表示程度，相當於「 很 」。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧驚夢》：「無奈高堂，喚醒紗窗睡不便。潑新鮮冷汗粘煎。」
From " water", "to make" sound, the original meaning is to pour the liquid outward to spread it out. The Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie's "Qi Min Yao Shu ‧ Creation of Divine Koji and Wine": "Draw 20 dendrites of water, don't make people splash water." " Pouring" can mean cooking or boiling. Tang Zhang Youxin "The Notes of Sencha Water": "Across the Tonglu River to Yanzise, the color of the stream is clear, and the water tastes very cold. The family members splashed it with old black and bad tea, and it was all aromatic." " Splashing" also generally refers to things spilling out of an inclined or overturned container. "The Scholars" Chapter 10: "Chen Hefu was startled, and stood up in a panic. His sleeves turned the bowl of powder soup over and splashed the table." " Po" is also used as an adjective to describe fierce and arrogant. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 44: "Sister Feng, seeing people coming, didn't splash like she did before. She smashed everyone down and ran to Jia's mother crying." " Po" can also be described as extremely large and numerous. Yuan Zhang Guobin's "He Undershirt" 4% off: "If you talk about my ancestors, good furniture is like splashing the sky." " Po" is also used as an adverb to express degree, which is equivalent to " very". Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion-Surprise Dream": "Helplessly, waking up the screen window to sleep inconvenience. Pour fresh cold sweat and fry.

潑字的基本解释

潑
pō
见“泼”。

潑字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pō］
［《集韻》普活切，入末，滂。］
“泼1”的繁体字。
(1)将液体向外倾洒，使散开。
(2)泛指东西从倾斜或翻倒的容器里泻出。
(3)映，映照。参见“潑眼”。
(4)烹，煮。
(5)满，遍及。参见“潑天”。
(6)淹，溺。
(7)凶悍，蛮横。
(8)有魄力；猛勇。
(9)表示厌恶、鄙视之词。犹言卑贱，卑劣，可恶。
(10)胡乱地。参见“潑説”。
(11)溢，泛。
(12)生长旺盛、茁壮有力。
(13)副词。表示程度，相当于“很”。
[②]［bō］
“泼2”的繁体字。
(1)见“潑2潑”。
(2)量词。同“撥”。相当于“番”。
(3)量词。同“撥”。相当于“群”。

潑字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　潑； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页648第34
【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?普活切，音鏺。【玉篇】水漏也。一曰弃水也。　又【李翊·俗呼小錄】雨一番一起爲一潑。　又【孫穆·鷄林類事】高麗方言謂足曰潑。　又【韻補】叶傍各切，音泊。【蘇軾詩】雨霽讀書處，亂翠曉如潑。偏偏貯秋雨，歲歲壞籬落。　【集韻】或省作?。

潑字的源字形

Basic explanation of words
splash
pō

splash
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [pō]
["Jiyun" is lively, enters the end, and is full of emotions. ]
The traditional characters of "Po 1".
(1) Pour the liquid outward to disperse it.
(2) Generally refers to things escaping from an inclined or overturned container.
(3) Reflect, reflect. See "splashing eyes".
(4) Cooking, boiling.
(5) Full, all over. See "splashing sky".
(6) Drowning and drowning.
(7) Fierce and arrogant.
(8) Vigorous; fierce.
(9) Words that express disgust and contempt. Still saying humble, despicable, and hateful.
(10) Indiscriminately. See "Push Talk".
(11) Overflow, pan.
(12) Grow vigorously and vigorously.
(13) Adverbs. Indicates the degree, which is equivalent to "very".
[②]［bō］
The traditional characters of "Po 2".
(1) See "splash 2 splash".
(2) Quantifiers. Same as "dial". Equivalent to "fan".
(3) Quantifiers. Same as "dial". Equivalent to "group".

One said, abandoning water.　[Li Yi·Shou Hu Xiaolu] Let the rain splash together.　[Sun Mu·Jilin-like things] Goryeo dialect called Zu said po.　[Rhyme Supplement] The leaves are cut at each side, and the sound is parked. [Su Shi's Poems] Yu Ji's reading place is full of chaos and cuixiao. However, the autumn rains are stored, and the fences fall every year.　【Jiyun】or provincial work?.
